mscFrUniTraceRowStatusTable.name: mscFrUniTraceRowStatusTable
mscFrUniTraceRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscFrUniTrace components.

mscFrUniTraceRowStatusEntry.name: mscFrUniTraceRowStatusEntry
mscFrUniTraceRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscFrUniTrace component.

mscFrUniTraceRowStatus.name: mscFrUniTraceRowStatus
mscFrUniTraceRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscFrUniTrace components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscFrUniTraceComponentName.name: mscFrUniTraceComponentName
mscFrUniTraceComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscFrUniTraceStorageType.name: mscFrUniTraceStorageType
mscFrUniTraceStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscFrUniTrace tables.

mscFrUniTraceIndex.name: mscFrUniTraceIndex
mscFrUniTraceIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscFrUniTrace tables.

mscFrUniTraceOperationalTable.name: mscFrUniTraceOperationalTable
mscFrUniTraceOperationalTable.description: This group provides the operational attributes for the Trace component.

mscFrUniTraceReceiverName.name: mscFrUniTraceReceiverName
mscFrUniTraceReceiverName.description: This attribute should be set to the name of the desired trace receiver before starting a trace session. All available trace receivers are listed under the Trace Rcvr/<string> component. This attribute cannot be set while a trace is active.

mscFrUniTraceDuration.name: mscFrUniTraceDuration
mscFrUniTraceDuration.description: This attribute specifies the duration, in minutes, of a trace session. A value of 0 indicates unlimited duration in which case a trace session remains active until a stop command is issued. The default duration is 60 minutes. This attribute cannot be set while a trace is active.

mscFrUniTraceQueueLimit.name: mscFrUniTraceQueueLimit
mscFrUniTraceQueueLimit.description: This attribute specifies the total number of bytes of traced data which may be queued for transmission to the trace receiver. When this limit is exceeded, incoming traced frames are discarded. This attribute can be set while a trace is active and takes effect immediately.

mscFrUniTraceSession.name: mscFrUniTraceSession
mscFrUniTraceSession.description: This attribute is set automatically. It identifies the Trace Session component which is forwarding the trace data. This attribute is empty unless a trace is active.

mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatusTable.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatusTable
mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscFrUniTraceFilter components.

mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatusEntry.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatusEntry
mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscFrUniTraceFilter component.

mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatus.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatus
mscFrUniTraceFilterRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscFrUniTraceFilter components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

mscFrUniTraceFilterComponentName.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterComponentName
mscFrUniTraceFilterComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscFrUniTraceFilterStorageType.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterStorageType
mscFrUniTraceFilterStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscFrUniTraceFilter tables.

mscFrUniTraceFilterIndex.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterIndex
mscFrUniTraceFilterIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscFrUniTraceFilter tables.

mscFrUniTraceFilterOperationalTable.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterOperationalTable
mscFrUniTraceFilterOperationalTable.description: This group provides the operational attributes for the Frame Relay Trace Filter component.

mscFrUniTraceFilterTraceType.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterTraceType
mscFrUniTraceFilterTraceType.description: This attribute specifies the level of filtering required for this trace session. A value of lmi indicates that Lmi frames are traced. A value of dlci indicates that frames from the Dlci specified by the tracedDlci attribute are traced. A value of badFrames indicates that bad received frames (overruns, CRC errors, aborts) are traced. The default is to trace all frames. This attribute can be set while a trace is active and takes effect immediately. Description of bits: lmi(0) dlci(1) badFrames(2)

mscFrUniTraceFilterTracedDlci.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterTracedDlci
mscFrUniTraceFilterTracedDlci.description: This attribute specifies a particular Dlci to trace. A value of zero specifies that all Dlcis are to be traced. This attribute can be set while a trace is active and takes effect immediately.

mscFrUniTraceFilterDirection.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterDirection
mscFrUniTraceFilterDirection.description: This attribute specifies the direction of the data to be traced as viewed by the service. The values can be egress, and/or ingress. An egress value indicates frames outbound from the service. An ingress value indicates frames inbound to the service. This attribute can be set while a trace is active and takes effect immediately. Description of bits: egress(0) ingress(1)

mscFrUniTraceFilterTracedLength.name: mscFrUniTraceFilterTracedLength
mscFrUniTraceFilterTracedLength.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of bytes to trace per frame starting from the byte following the frame flag. If the frame length is longer than the value specified by this attribute, then the traced frame is truncated. This attribute can be set while a trace is active and takes effect immediately.
